alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 3:53PM EDT until May 09 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maryland...West Virginia... Potomac River at Shepherdstown affecting Jefferson, Washington and Berkeley Counties. For the Potomac River...including Paw Paw, Hancock, Dam Number Five, Shepherdstown, Harpers Ferry, Point of Rocks, Edwards Ferry, Little Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Potomac River at Shepherdstown. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Water covers the pedestrian bridge adjacent to the Shepherdstown boat ramp. Significant portions of the C&O Canal towpath are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:31 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.2 feet, or 3.8 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 19.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.2 feet on 02/28/1936. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sat Sun Sun Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 8PM 2AM 8AM Stg Time Date Potomac River Shepherdstown 15.0 11.2 Sat 3 pm 12.7 15.7 17.4 19.2 8pm Sun &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM EDT.
